excerpt.rendered: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

content.rendered: Artur Sychov is Founder and CEO of Somnium Space. He has been navigating virtual worlds for more than two decades starting with Ultima Online in 1999, then Second Life and many more. Artur strongly believes in the ultimate future of Virtual Reality worlds with open and decentralized economy.

meta.title: The Polys - WebXR Awards and Summit Series

content.rendered: Chris started working on web browsers in 1993 when he co-authored the original Windows version of NCSA Mosaic, worked on Internet Explorer for fifteen years at Microsoft, and joined Google in 2010. He is currently Web Standards Tech Lead on Chrome.

Christopher Lafayette is an emergent technologist in XR applying his talents to Medtech, FinTech, Climate and applied sciences.

He is working for a more equitable future in technology serving as a Silicon Valley national and international speaker, thought leader and a culture advocate.

Evo Heyning has been creating immersive experiences that bridge real and virtual worlds for more than 20 years. As an interactive showrunner and production strategist, she has worked on media projects ranging from launching the Affordable Care Act to producing more than 500 hours of livestreaming events during the pandemic. Her work focuses on metaverse media and the creative potential of volumetric and virtual production. Evo passionately shapes the future of the open spatial web to connect people and groundbreaking, applicable ideas through collaborative technologies. Through her company Playable Agency, Evo provides early stage production strategy and creative worldbuilding that expand reality.

Gabe is a product manager and developer who has worked somewhere at the intersection of education, immersive technology, and collaborative tools for the past 10 years. He lives in Southern California, creates instrumental music in his free time, and enjoys working with curious, passionate people.
Exploring the possibilities of the web

Joanna Popper is an award-winning Hollywood and Silicon Valley media executive with a track record of launching cutting edge content and technology to drive revenue, audience engagement and brand love.

She currently leads HP’s Virtual Reality initiatives for Go-To-Market and Location Based Entertainment. Prior she was EVP of Media & Marketing at Singularity University and VP Marketing at NBCUniversal.

Joanna is Executive Producer on “Breonna’s Garden” which premiered at the Tribeca Festival. This augmented reality experience was created by Lady PhoEnix and Sutu with Ju’Niyah Palmer to honor the life of her sister, Breonna Taylor.

Joanna was Executive Producer on Double Eye Studios’ “Finding Pandora X,” winner of Venice Film Festival Golden Lion for Best VR Experience and the SXSW Audience Award for Virtual Cinema Spotlight. Finding Pandora X is a modern day take on Greek mythology live interactive experience in VRChat.

Joanna was selected as “50 Women Can Change the World in Media and Entertainment,” “Top 50 Original Thinkers in VR,” “Top Women in Media: Game Changers,” “Top Women in Media: Industry Leaders,” “Digital It List,” “101 Women Leading the VR Industry” and is on the Coalition for the Women in XR Fund.

meta.title: HP
meta.company: Global Head of Go to Market VR

content.rendered:
Julie Smithson’s personal mission is to ‘inspire and educate people to think and act in a socially, economically and environmentally responsible way’.

It is through this lens as co-founder at MetaVRse, one of the world’s leading virtual , augmented and mixed reality (XR) consulting & product development companies. Changing the way we teach using the MetaVRse game engine introducing 3D learning & spatial design without code.

Dr. June Wang currently serves as Senior Vice President at Futurewei Technologies. She has 20 years of experience in companies such as Qualcomm, Ericsson, Huawei, etc., with expertise in product management, strategy, marketing, and business development in wireless terminals and the mobile ecosystem. She was also a pivotal leader in account management interfacing with large U.S operators such as Verizon Wireless. In 2015, Dr. Wang helped drive breakthroughs like partnering with Google on the Nexus 6P and Android Wear flagship device. In 2016 she led a team to build a joint lab with Microsoft to support her company’s PC product line. In 2017-2018 her team gained Google VR/AR/Lens Product Area certification and supported partners’ efforts on the first rollout of Android Go and Android Messaging (RCS). In recent years, Dr. Wang’s department focusing on managing master agreements/contracts that are fully compliant with local regulations with top partners in the ecosystem. She believes in the power of open source and fully supports the WebXR efforts in the community.
content

title.rendered: Mark Zuckerberg: Meta Interoperability Excerpt Oct 28

content.rendered: Neil works at NVIDIA to help developers use GPUs and is involved with open standards to help the industry move forward so we can all see what comes next sooner. The metaverse has been a long-term inspiration, even if he didn’t realize it at the time. He has helped OpenGL onto PCs, served as President of the Web3D Consortium, and as Khronos President has been involved in the creation of multiple widely adopted standards for 3D and XR including OpenGL ES, WebGL, Vulkan, SPIR-V, glTF and OpenXR.

meta.title: Valorem Reply
meta.company: Director of Global Innovation, Research & Incubation

content.rendered: Alina is an Art Director Design Researcher, WebXR Developer; Director of Communications of the Open AR Cloud Association and Managing Director of Open AR Cloud Europe gUG as well as Lead Strategist of the Cyber XR Coalition. With a passion for immersive Tech, Spatial Computing, Spatial Web and creating a human centered future of Computing.

Amy Peck is the Founder & CEO of EndeavorXR, a leading global XR strategy & consulting firm. She is a recognized thought-leader in the space and speaks globally on the future of XR and exponential technologies.
Amy holds multiple Advisory Board roles and is a Venture Partner at the Capital Region XR
Accelerator. She is Co-chair of Prospera Women, a global organization supporting female-led
startups and was Founding Co-chair of the VRAR Association Enterprise Committee.
She actively mentors entrepreneurs and is a member of several Women in Tech, Venture-backed Accelerators & STEM Education organizations.

Through EndeavorVR, she works with Fortune 500 companies and tech startups on XR strategy, content, development, product and GTM.

Her own personal mission is to see technology accessible to all – fundamentally improving every aspect of our lives and elevating the way we work, learn, communicate and play.

title.rendered: Robert Long – Open Metaverse Interoperability Group

content.rendered: Terry xR. Schussler is an award-winning software designer/developer currently driving @deutschetelekom’s XR HMD initiatives as Senior Director, Spatial Computing. Terry co-produced the XRCollaboration.com website – part of his effort to inspire us to use XR technologies to improve our interactions with each other and the real world. His mission is to encourage us to move from a heads-down to a heads-up society. Terry regularly mentors innovators trying to make a difference in XR through Deutsche Telekom’s startup accelerator hub:raum and other programs.
Head of Product Innovation, XR and E-commerce

meta.title: Unity
meta.company: Head of XR Ads and E-Commerce

content.rendered: Dr. Yu Yuan (Candidate for 2022 IEEE Standards Association President-Elect) is a visionary researcher, inventor, practitioner, and entrepreneur in the areas of Consumer Technology, Multimedia/VR/AR, Connected/Automated Vehicles, IoT, and Digital Transformation. He founded 0xSenses Corporation, a multinational technology company specializing in Virtual Reality. Dedicated to “Creating Better Worlds” as its long-term vision, the company is developing technologies, infrastructures, ecosystems, and resources needed for massively multiplayer ultra-realistic virtual experiences. Prior to this he worked for IBM Research as a research scientist and was a key contributor to IBM’s Cell Broadband Engine, Smarter Planet, and IoT initiative. He has been a passionate volunteer in various leadership positions at IEEE and other professional communities. His outstanding service in IEEE standards activities at different levels (working groups, standards committees, and governance at higher levels) has been widely appreciated by standards developers, individual members, and corporate members. He has a Ph.D., an M.S., and a B.S. in Computer Science from Tsinghua University.

Dr. Karen Alexander is a sought-after consultant on building immersive learning programs with extensive connections across the XR industry and academia. Her experience spans partnering with community organizations on giving children and youth the opportunity to create with XR tools, guiding higher ed institutions through the process of XR adoption, advising ed tech and XR startups, and, in her role as an immersive learning consultant with MetaVRse, pioneering the translation of of 2D training into 3D experiences for enterprise. 

Dr. Alexander is a co-founder of XR Women, a worldwide network of professionals that meet weekly in virtual worlds and where a distinguished list of XR industry speakers has appeared. As part of the team that produces The Polys – WebXR Awards, WebXR Summit Series, and MetaTr@versal, she has worked with some of the most influential thought leaders in spatial computing. Bringing her passion for metaverse literacy back to her academic roots, Dr. Alexander is host of the WebXR Education Summit, assembling a diverse array of practitioners to share knowledge on successful implementation of immersive learning. She is also a member of the Immersive Learning Research Network’s State of XR and Immersive Learning Expert Panel. 

Prior to her work in XR, Dr. Alexander was Dean of Junior and Senior Year programs at the women’s college at Rutgers University and Senior Editor of Signs: Journal of Women and Culture in Society. Her experience in higher education ranges across teaching, program design, journal editing, and college administration, with specializations in art, literature, film, and cultural production. Dr. Alexander is committed to women’s advancement and gender and racial equality and believes in a Humanity First approach to XR and the metaverse. She holds master’s degrees in English, Philosophy, and Issues in Modern Culture and earned her PhD. at the University of London.

Daniel Ljunggren has 10 years of accomplishments within Product Management and another 10 years within Business Development & Strategic Partnerships gained from global leadership roles within the smartphone, mobile apps & services, IoT, and AR/VR industry.

Dulce Baerga has been producing interactive content for over 20 years. Building sites ranging from entertainment based portals to product based community sites. She’s a self-taught full stack developer, front-end engineer and network/IT manager who’s passionate about augmented reality and virtual reality platforms. Her skill set includes developing concepts, programming demos, creating UI/UX design, scripting user interactivity, building 3D simulations, creating virtual products, and building webXR apps. She’s also an active resident of multiple virtual worlds, top prize winner at XR related hackathons, and deeply embedded in the XR community. Dulce is currently pushing the edges of the immersive web and augmented reality, creating XR MVPs for clients and collaboration projects. Immersive theater and mixed reality storytelling are two verticals of focus where she’s been creating production pipelines and UI/UX mechanics. Iterating on and streamlining new XR pipelines to create base MVPs is Dulce’s primary directive while pushing the XR envelope.

Experienced entrepreneur with a professional background in creative media in the US, Europe, and Asia. In 2015, when VR/AR exploded onto the scene, Terry saw the potential in a growing creative market whose professionals would need help with strategic and business development advice. Since then Terry founded his XR Business Consulting agency, Ubereal, and the leading VR/AR directory and showcase: VirtualRealityMarketing.com

Tedx and Global speaker. Experienced Executive with strong leadership and strategic skills. Recently recognized as the 2013 “Business Person of the Year” by the Harlem Business Alliance for implementing innovative strategies for non-profit and for profit clients and exceeding objectives.

Skilled in content, technology, brand development, multimedia, online web and multiplatform production, for domestic and international operations. A track record of positive results in P&L management, multi-channel distribution, product launches, new market recognition, and growing the bottom-line while motivating an accomplished staff in a dynamic business environment.

Austin Caine, a.k.a Cause, is a professional world designer specializing in building bespoke 3D event spaces for social VR platforms. He is a prominent builder in AltspaceVR having created some of the more popular entertainment spaces (such as The Flying Saucer and The Worm Hole) and has helped to spark innovation in many other creators. He is also an admin and consultant for the yearly BRCvr virtual “Burning Man” event held in Altspace, and has worked with many people to help bring their creative ideas to fruition. These days he and his partner Christi work closely together on many VR and XR projects to deliver clients a higher level of atmospheric quality while maintaining optimal download speeds and visual framerates.

Christi Fenison is an immersive storyteller, 3D artist, 360 videographer and simulation designer.
Her passion is creating XR experiences that expand perspectives and inspire action. Drawing on principles of narrative transport, cognitive elaboration and the sense of presence, she works to bring big picture ideas to life via the careful interplay of meaningful details.
By day, Christi works as an XR Instructional Media Producer at UNC School of Medicine IT, focused on the research, development and integration of XR training simulations in curriculum. Beyond the classroom, she is also a bespoke World Builder for Social VR events, crafting custom experiences tailored to each client’s vision and goals.
Christi received her Master’s degree from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill’s Environment and Science Communication program, where focused on Emerging Technologies, 3D Modeling + Unity Development, Green Architecture + Sustainable Design, Geospatial Information Systems, and Immersive Journalism.

Jacquelyn Morie is a pioneer in the domains of computer graphics and virtual reality. She is the founder of All These Worlds, LLC, a company that creates and supports Virtual World experiences and research. Her clients have included NASA, the University of Southern California’s Institute for Creative Technologies (USC/ICT), XPRIZE and the Army Medical Command.

Her ongoing research focuses on how immersion can affect and benefit participants, how the use of Avatars changes both our social connections and our deep understanding of our sense of self, and how multisensory elements combine to create a cognitive gestalt that enhances the feelings of Presence in virtual experiences.

Her 2007 PhD thesis – Meaning and Emplacement in Expressive Immersive Virtual Environments – has been downloaded hundreds of times by emerging VR communities, serving as a deep first introduction and guide to the many important aspects of this new medium, from its female-centric history to a design methodology for emotional impact. It was completed under the supervision of Dr Lizbeth Goodman at the SMARTlab Digital Media Institute University College Dublin, Ireland.

Dr Morie is a long time educator, having created digital programs at the University of Central Florida, the Ringling College of Art and Design, and Otis College of Art and Design. She is the original developer of the first computer animation training program for Walt Disney Feature Animation in the 1990s, as well as similar training programs for companies in the Digital Effects industries, such as Rhythm and Hues Studios. She is a former member of the DARPA ISAT Group, tasked with investigating new topics for DARPA research, and a founder of the USC/ICT, where she served as Senior Scientist for 14 years. She is a three decades member of ACM SIGGRAPH and has served that organization in many capacities over the years.
